name: Footer
description: Footer component with multiple content sections for site footer. Provides structured layout for site-wide footer information including navigation, legal content, and branding elements.

background_image.description: Background image URL for footer styling.

content_top1.description: First content slot in the top footer section.

content_top2.description: Second content slot in the top footer section.

content_middle1.description: First content slot in the middle footer section.

content_middle2.description: Second content slot in the middle footer section.

content_middle3.description: Third content slot in the middle footer section.

content_middle4.description: Fourth content slot in the middle footer section.

content_middle5.description: Fifth content slot in the middle footer section.

content_bottom1.description: First content slot in the bottom footer section.

content_bottom2.description: Second content slot in the bottom footer section.

examples.name: Basic Footer
examples.description: Simple footer with navigation and copyright

examples.name: Full Footer
examples.description: Complete footer with all content sections

when_to_use: Create consistent site-wide footer across all pages
Provide secondary navigation and utility links
Display legal information and copyright notices
Show contact information and social media links
Present organizational branding and additional resources
when_not_to_use: For page-specific footer content - use content sections instead
As primary navigation - use header navigation components
For content that changes frequently - consider dynamic content areas
When a simple copyright notice would suffice
best_practices: Organize content logically in the three-tier structure (top, middle, bottom)
Use appropriate content hierarchy with the most important information prominently placed
Ensure all footer links are accessible and properly labeled
Maintain consistent styling with the overall site design
Include essential legal information and accessibility statements
Test footer usability across different screen sizes
Consider loading performance with background images

accessibility.notes: Component provides proper semantic footer markup with navigation landmarks and accessible link structures.

variations: Content sections: Top (2 slots), middle (5 slots), bottom (2 slots)
Background options: With or without background image styling
Theme variations: Light and dark theme support
Content types: Navigation, branding, legal, contact, social media
Layout flexibility: Responsive grid system for different screen sizes

findings: Users expect consistent footer content across site pages
Footer navigation provides important secondary access to site sections
Contact information and legal links are commonly sought in footers
Social media links in footers help users connect with organizations
Clear visual hierarchy in footers improves content findability
